papers.title: Electron-Ion Collider Proposals Worldwide
authors: This talk should review the status of world-wide Electron-Ion Colliders proposals and designs
eRHIC at BNL and the LHeC at CERN.

papers.title: Beam Physics in Future Electron Hadron Colliders
authors: High-energy electron-hadron collisions could support a rich research programme in particle and nuclear physics. Several future projects are being proposed around the world
in particular eRHIC at BNL and MEIC at JLAB in the US
and LHeC at CERN in Europe. This presentation will highlight some of the accelerator physics issues
and describe related technical developments and challenges for these machines. In particular
optics design and beam dynamics studies are discussed
as well as mitigation measures for beam break up and for space-charge induced emittance growth
all of which could limit the machine performance. Finally
first steps are presented towards an LHeC R&D facility
which should investigate relevant beam-physics processes.
